definition: to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
to compare/to dispute/compared to/(before adj.) relatively/comparatively/rather/also pr. [jiao3]
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs

sentences.english: Bajiu Shi - year - old man , nature as a child , to care too much?
sentences.chinese: 八九十岁的老人，性情就像孩子，能太计较么？

sentences.english: You can accomplish much if you do not care who gels the credit.
sentences.chinese: 一个人假如不计较功劳归属于谁，他的成就就会更大。

sentences.english: The cook and the grocer haggled over the price of eggs.
sentences.chinese: 厨师和杂货商为蛋价计较个没完。

sentences.english: With the ifs and the maybes, we cannot go forward.
sentences.chinese: 如果总是计较这些，我们就无法前进。

sentences.english: The two boys agreed to let bygones be bygones and made friends again.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男孩同意不计较过去，而且重归于好了。

sentences.english: In friends' heart, I've been marginalized as a cocky man unworthy of care. "Unaccountable"!
sentences.chinese: 在朋友的心目中，你早已沦为不值得计较的妄人。

sentences.english: Similarly, many of us who are on a budget are always on the lookout for a bargain.
sentences.chinese: 类似的，我们大多数有预算压力的人总是斤斤计较。

sentences.english: People that are in love tend to look beyond minor annoyances to the bigger picture.
sentences.chinese: 沐浴在爱中的人会顾全大局而不会计较一些小缺陷。

sentences.english: But can fly and shen heart care?
sentences.chinese: 但高飞能和沈心计较吗？

sentences.english: He is always cold, and arrogant towards others.
sentences.chinese: 他一向冷傲对人，你不必和他计较。

sentences.english: As long as you don't care about gain and loss, life still have what can't a way to overcome?
sentences.chinese: 只要你不计较得失，人生还有什么不能想法子克服的？

sentences.english: And still, law enforcement seems inclined to let off banks for their misconduct.
sentences.chinese: 然而，法律似乎倾向于不计较银行的不端行为。

sentences.english: In friends’ heart, I’ve been marginalized as a cocky man unworthy of care.
sentences.chinese: 在朋友的心目中，你早已沦为不值得计较的妄人。

sentences.english: Warrington was curious, and not ill pleased at the musician's taunts and irascibility.
sentences.chinese: 沃林顿有些惊讶，但没有计较乐师的奚落和愤怒。

sentences.english: For a lost thing cares nothing.
Each student's marks were totaled and entered in alist.
sentences.chinese: 每个学生的总分都已计较出来平列入表中。

definition: to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
to mind/to brood over/to be concerned about
to care about/to mind
to lower oneself to sb's level/to argue with sb less well-informed
to care about/equivalent of 在於|在于[zai4 yu2]
to care about/to take seriously/to take to heart
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to have misgivings/apprehension/worry/qualm/scruple
magnanimous/generous (in spirit)
narrow-minded/petty
to sulk/to squabble
to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
to insist on/to demand/to impose
to understand/to pay attention to/to take notice of
to haggle over every cent (idiom)
lit. chicken feathers and garlic skins (idiom)/fig. trivial (matter)
